sleep_index.title: Your Sleep Index trend over the last 3 weeks
sleep_index.description: The sleep index is designed to be one single metric you need to judge your sleep health, using several contributors like total sleep duration, resting HR, restfulness.

insights.description: Your overall sleep index has gone down compared to the previous week. Checkout which contributors to fix and how to improve them.

best_contributors.title: Restorative Sleep
best_contributors.description: Restorative sleep is a measure of contributions of REM and Deep sleep.

best_contributors.title: Restfulness
best_contributors.description: Restfulness is measured on the basis of your movement and awake windows during sleep.

best_contributors.title: Temperature Deviation
best_contributors.description: Your core temperature drops by a degree or two as just before and during sleep. And a few hours before you wake up again, it starts to rise. This is a measure of that deviation

worst_contributors.title: Timing
worst_contributors.description: This represents the adherence to your Circadian Rhythm.

insights.title: How to improve Consistency?
insights.description: If you canâ€™t fix your sleep start time, fix your wake up time to ensure your circadian rhythm is proper.

worst_contributors.title: Total Sleep
worst_contributors.description: It represents the volume of uninterrupted sleep every night for your body.

insights.title: How to improve Total Sleep?
insights.description: Preparing your sleep environment is important to ensure higher total sleep hours. Address factors like noise level via ear buds, room darkness and temperature ( slight lower i.e around 18-19 deg celsius ) and the number of electronic devices in your room.

worst_contributors.title: HR Drop
worst_contributors.description: HR Drop is a measure of how soon your body is able to get in to a state of rest and recovery.

insights.title: How to improve HR Drop?
insights.description: You can make your HR drop early during sleep by avoiding stimulants and physical exercise in the later half of the day. Winding down closer to your sleep hours is a good practice and will help improve the probability of your HR dropping early.

recovery_index.title: Your Recovery Index trend over the last 3 weeks
recovery_index.description: The Recovery Score indicates your overall state of 'well-being'. It depends on markers like resting heart rate, hrv, temperature, sleep quality, movement and recovery.

insights.description: Your overall recovery index has improved compared to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: HRV Form
best_contributors.description: This metric represents your HRV patterns and deviations which are indicators of your body's adaptability.

best_contributors.title: Resting Heart Rate
best_contributors.description: Put simply, the more efficient your heart becomes, the lower your resting heart rate gets.

best_contributors.title: Temperature
best_contributors.description: Your body temperature is an indicator of your body's state of recovery

worst_contributors.title: Movement Index
worst_contributors.description: This represents your overall movement trends.

insights.title: How to improve Movement Index?
insights.description: Moving for 4 mins and stretching for 1 min every hour is a simple yet extremely effective way to ensure better posture, circulation and energy expenditure.

worst_contributors.title: Sleep Quotient
worst_contributors.description: Sleep quality and duration are factored into this metric.

insights.title: How to improve Sleep Quotient?
insights.description: Sleep discipline starts with setting a routine. Try to sleep and wake up at the same time even if you are not able to get enough sleep. This will help avoid fatigue due to lack of sleep.

movement_index.title: Your Movement Index trend over the last 3 weeks
movement_index.description: The Movement Index is designed to keep you moving for optimal glucose metabolism and increase your non-exercise energy usage. Its a measure of how active you were that day.

insights.description: Your overall movement index has improved compared to the previous week. Checkout which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Workout Frequency
best_contributors.description: This metric counts the number of days you were really active and the number of workouts you did to add in a more long term measure of your activity.

worst_contributors.title: Steps
worst_contributors.description: This represents the number of steps you've taken and how you're comparing to what's expected based on your routine.

insights.title: How to improve Steps Score?
insights.description: Walking for 15 mins after your meals has an added advantage of optimizing glucose spikes apart from increased energy expenditure.
